fontys.time

Interface IPeriod

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Period

    public interface IPeriod
    A stretch of time with a begin time and end time. The end time is always later then the begin time; the length of the period is always positive WARNING: length of period should be smaller than Integer.MAXINT; this restriction will never be checked

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeLengthWith(int minutes)
      the end time of this period will be moved up with [minutes] minutes

    • Method Detail

      • getBeginTime

        ITime getBeginTime()
        Returns:
        the begin time of this period

      • getEndTime

        ITime getEndTime()
        Returns:
        the end time of this period

      • length

        int length()
        Returns:
        the length of this period expressed in minutes (always positive)

      • setBeginTime

        void setBeginTime(ITime beginTime)
        beginTime will be the new begin time of this period
        Parameters:
        beginTime - must be earlier than the current end time of this period

      • setEndTime

        void setEndTime(ITime endTime)
        endTime will be the new end time of this period
        Parameters:
        endTime - must be later than the current begin time of this period

      • move

        void move(int minutes)
        the begin and end time of this period will be moved up both with [minutes] minutes
        Parameters:
        minutes - (a negative value is allowed)

      • changeLengthWith

        void changeLengthWith(int minutes)
        the end time of this period will be moved up with [minutes] minutes
        Parameters:
        minutes - minutes + length of this period must be positive

      • isPartOf

        boolean isPartOf(IPeriod period)
        Parameters:
        period -
        Returns:
        true if all moments within this period are included within [period], otherwise false

      • unionWith

        IPeriod unionWith(IPeriod period)
        Parameters:
        period -
        Returns:
        if this period and [period] are consecutive or possess a common intersection, then the smallest period p will be returned, for which this period and [period] are part of p, otherwise null will be returned

      • intersectionWith

        IPeriod intersectionWith(IPeriod period)
        Parameters:
        period -
        Returns:
        the largest period which is part of this period and [period] will be returned; if the intersection is empty null will be returned
